Bainbridge is located north of Lake Seminole on the Flint River in southwest Georgia. Fishing, camping, sightseeing and waterskiing are popular with locals and visitors alike. Bainbridge hosts many bass tournaments due to its size and proximity to the lake. Several WMAs provide abundant hunting activities.

Many visitors arrive in Bainbridge via US Highway 27 or US Highway 84. It is one hour north of Tallahassee Regional Airport (TLH) and four hours south of Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International (ATL) via US Highway 27.
Bainbridge / Decatur county has many historic homes and markers.

value: name=Decatur County Historical and Genealogical  Museum

The area has shopping, golf, camping, fishing, hunting and sightseeing.
There are several shopping areas in Bainbridge that include local, regional and national merchants.
Stay locally at motels or campgrounds.
